getBondLength

public static double getBondLength(ChemicalElement el1,
                                   ChemicalElement el2)
calculates bondlength. uses sum of covalent radii. if covalent radii cannot be found, use bond length of 1.0

Parameters:
el1 - element
el2 - element
Returns:
length

calculate3DCoordinates0

public static java.util.List<Point3> calculate3DCoordinates0(Point3 aPoint,
                                                             int geometry,
                                                             double length)
                                                      throws EuclidException
Calculates substituent points. Calculate substituent points for (0) zero ligands of aPoint. The resultant points are randomly oriented: (i) 1 points required; +x,0,0 (ii) 2 points: use +x,0,0 and -x,0,0 (iii) 3 points: equilateral triangle in xy plane (iv) 4 points x,x,x, x,-x,-x, -x,x,-x, -x,-x,x where 3x**2 = bond length

Parameters:
aPoint - to which substituents are added
geometry - from: ANY, LINEAR, TRIGONAL, TETRAHEDRAL
length - from aPoint
Returns:
Point3[] ANY => 1, LINEAR => 2, TRIGONAL => 3, TETRAHEDRAL => 4
Throws:
EuclidException

calculate3DCoordinates1

public static java.util.List<Point3> calculate3DCoordinates1(Point3 aPoint,
                                                             Point3 bPoint,
                                                             Point3 cPoint,
                                                             int geometry,
                                                             double length,
                                                             double angle)
                                                      throws EuclidException
Calculate new point(s) X in a B-A system to form B-A-X. Use C as reference for * staggering about the B-A bond the X-A-B-C angle is 2*pi (1a) 1 ligand(B) of refAtom (A) which itself has a ligand (C) (i) 1 points required; vector along AB vector (ii) 2 points: 2 vectors in ABC plane, staggered and eclipsed wrt C (iii) 3 points: 1 staggered wrt C, the others +- gauche wrt C If C is null, a random non-colinear C is generated Note: If a pyramidal geometry (e.g. for C-N(-H)-H) is wanted, use TETRAHEDRAL and the user must decide which point(s) to use

Parameters:
aPoint - to which substituents are added
bPoint - reference ligand
cPoint - further ligand of bPoint to generate stagger
geometry - from: LINEAR, TRIGONAL, TETRAHEDRAL
length - A-X length
angle - B-A-X angle in radians
Returns:
Point3d[] nwanted points (or zero if failed)
Throws:
EuclidException

calculate3DCoordinates2

public static java.util.List<Point3> calculate3DCoordinates2(Point3 aPoint,
                                                             Point3 bPoint,
                                                             Point3 cPoint,
                                                             int geometry,
                                                             double length,
                                                             double angle)
                                                      throws EuclidException
Calculate new point(s) X in a B-A-C system. It forms form a B-A(-C)-X system. (2) 2 ligands(B, C) of refAtom A (i) 1 points required; vector in ABC plane bisecting AB, AC. If ABC is linear, no points (ii) 2 points: 2 points X1, X2, X1-A-X2 = angle about 2i vector Note: If a pyramidal geometry (e.g. for C-N(-C)-H) is wanted, use TETRAHEDRAL

Parameters:
aPoint - to which substituents are added
bPoint - first ligand of A
cPoint - second ligand of A
geometry - from: TRIGONAL, TETRAHEDRAL
length - A-X length
angle - B-A-X angle
Returns:
Point3d[] nwanted points (or zero if failed)
Throws:
EuclidException

calculate3DCoordinates3

public static Point3 calculate3DCoordinates3(Point3 aPoint,
                                             Point3 bPoint,
                                             Point3 cPoint,
                                             Point3 dPoint,
                                             double length)
Calculate new point X in a B-A(-D)-C system. It forms a B-A(-D)(-C)-X system. (3) 3 ligands(B, C, D) of refAtom A (i) 1 points required; if A, B, C, D coplanar, no points. else vector is resultant of BA, CA, DA

Parameters:
aPoint - to which substituents are added
bPoint - first ligand of A
cPoint - second ligand of A
dPoint - third ligand of A
length - A-X length
Returns:
required point (or null if failed (coplanar))

public static void testCalculate3DCoordinates()
tests the calculation of ligand coordinates
